page.title: 14EVENTS
page.content: The sparse population of the area belies the use made of the{village {hall. }The Church uses it for Congregational Meetings, Sunday School and Women's Guild. The Playgroup meets there twice a week; the Women's Rural Institute once a month; and the Life boat Guild has at least one meeting each year. The hall is used as a polling station. A committee of local people run the hall and various events are organised to fundraise, especially at present, when an extension is planned with the aid of a Regional grant. Events range from sales of work, auctions, dances, and keep fit sessions. In November, local craft workers hold an Advent Sale which helps to draw people into the area. The hall is a wet weather haven for campers, Guides and B.B.s who often camp on Arbuthnott Estate.
